page.title: 17HOUSING/OVERTON+MIDDLETON
page.content: The main street of the village of Overton comprises old,renovated farm houses and cottages,in various states of repair.Built along the main street were no less than 10 farmhouses,with out-buildings,most of which are now private dwellings.Only 2 are still farmed.Several barn conversions have been made,one farmhouse is now a restaurant,and much of the centre of the village has been developed into 2 large private estates.The old converted Methodist chapel now rubs shoulders with 2 modern bungalows. A recent 80-house estate has been built to accomodate workers from the Heysham Nuclear Power Station,and the projected Gas Terminal.
